title.narrative: Multi-country proposal of humanitarian support to the Venezuelan migration crisis in border areas and along the migrant route in Venezuela to Colombia and Ecuador.

description.narrative: This project aims at providing assistance to migrants from Venezuela in transit, as well as vulnerable people located in informal settlements along the migrant route and border areas of Venezuela, Colombia and Ecuador. In Venezuela and Ecuador, the actions will be located in border areas. In Colombia, they will be located both in border areas and along the main migrant routes. The Action proposes to serve basic needs in terms of shelter (including food an hygiene), education in emergencies (EiE) and protection. The presence of armed groups and human traffickers is an enormousprotection risk and depending on the gender and age group this leads to: forced recruitment; human trafficking and sexual exploitation and abuse a.o. The installation of mobile and fixed Family Friendly Zones (FFZ), where psychosocial support, educational and recreational activities and the dissemination of legal information and available services will take place, is part of the protection strategy. ICT corners with internet and the possibility to charge electronic devices, allow the migrants to contact friends and family and access information about the journey. This contributes to a safer journey and possibly family reunification. Migrants in transit may stay in the SOS Villages as part of the shelter activities and they will receive food and hygiene kits. EiE is offered to out of school children around informal settlements (both migrants and hosts communities), thereby diminishing the education gap and allowing for a smooth reintegration into the formal education system. This Action targets families with children, unaccompanied and separated children and adolescents and pregnant and lactating women. The majority of activities will be implemented in Colombia because of the large number of migrants. Depending on the legal opening of the Venezuelan border, cross-border activities in Venezuela will start as planned. Support will be limited to protection through the Family Friendly Zones.

participating-org.narrative: European Commission - Humanitarian Aid & Civil Protection
